text: Exercise 3% Here is a wrong attempt to show that a language is not context-free. Consider the language Ls ={uu | u € fa,b)"). We use the pumping lemma to show that Ls is not context-free. Choose w = aabbaabb. So we can split it into u = aa, v = b, x = baa, y = bb and z = c. But then we have that uv?xy?z ¢ Ls. Explain the main reasons why the above attempt of proof is wrong.
